fields.title: Harris 1983 Omnibus Ronald Reagan and the Economy Survey, study no. 832112

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue:
This omnibus survey focuses on Ronald Reagan and the economy

Additional variables include Reagan job rating, memories of JFK, nuclear arms, Congress and the 1984 Presidential election

keyword.keywordValue: Comparison of Republican and Democratic Parties

fields.notesText:
Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Harris telephone surveys use a form of random digit dialing. From a random multi-stage cluster sampling design, they obtain a national cross-section of U.S. adults. Interviewers are usually given the first five digits of a series of randomly selected residential telephone num
bers that have previously been stratified by geographic locations, including minor civil divisions. The interviewer then adds two randomly generated digits to complete a new seven-digit number; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-8321-12;
